subject: Relationships
title: Validation: The Need to Be Understood
description: A short lesson to help you apply Validation: The Need to Be Understood.

hook.text: 'You shouldn't feel that way' is the fastest way to make someone feel twice as bad.

buildup.text: Validation means acknowledging someone's feelings as real and understandable â€” even if you disagree.

discovery.text: Psychologist Marsha Linehan found that validation reduces emotional distress faster than problem-solving.

twist.text: Validating doesn't mean agreeing. You can say 'That makes sense' while holding a completely different view.

climax.text: Most relationship pain isn't about the problem. It's about the partner who said your pain didn't matter.

punchline.text: 'That makes sense' heals more than 'Here's what you should do.'

quiz.question: What did Marsha Linehan find about validation?
options: It reduces emotional distress faster than problem-solving
